selected_quotes: Weather advisory: Tarzan, don't hang from lianas during lightning storm
Best thing about this story: the remote-controlled balloon/pistons that attract lightning bolts to trees!
Parasitic vines may serve as lightning rods, saving trees from damage
Well, well. Do rainforest vines act like lightning rods, saving trees from damage?

facebook.title: Headline: Parasitic vines may serve as lightning rods
facebook.summary: Field campaign in Panama will study whether lianas help trees to survive lightning strikes.

facebook.title: Parasitic vines may serve as lightning rods
Parasitic vines may serve as lightning rods
Parasitic vines may serve as lightning rods
facebook.summary:
Striking result!

Sadly the data here isn't that striking, yet. But preliminary research suggests that lianas may conduct lightning strikes to the ground rather than the trees of the forest where they are found. More work needed, and more work being done.
